Ù‡Ø¬Ø±Ø¨ Ø£Ø¶ÙŠÙ Ø§Ù„Ø­ØªÙ‡ Ø¨ØªØ§Ø¹Øª Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„Ù…ÙŠÙ…Ø¨Ø±Ø² ÙÙŠ ÙƒÙ„ Ø¬Ø±ÙˆØ¨ ÙˆØ§Ø¨ÙˆØ³ØªÙ‡ Ù‡Ù†Ø§Ùƒ :D

This is not exactly a review because im not that good yet :D  but those are some suggestions :

Using "with" when dealing with files is always a good idea.

https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343/

Also when iterating on the file lines you don't need to read lines before iterating on them. 

Example:

with open('file.config') as f:
      for line in f: 
           print line

I'll write this post in English, to keep the LTR layout

The code can be greatly simplified if you make small modifications to your regex & handle the file as a whole, instead of for-loop for each line

Also I changed it to read the path to ansible.cfg as a command-line parameter

https://gist.github.com/mtayseer/b94a5f436a9433a71d55
I have no idea what is happening here, but I love how Tayseer simplified the python code.

Abdallah Hodieb
